Brother, you shut it down very quickly, but I took a look

I found this part in the code. Here, 
https://github.com/apache/dubbo/blob/e845e1648f27abbc80828d4b87a7f126eb8d660a/dubbo-metadata/dubbo-metadata-api/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/metadata/report/support/AbstractMetadataReport.java#L107-L108


the value of the parameter file is taken from the url. This is the same as the one used by the registry. Here
https://github.com/apache/dubbo/blob/e845e1648f27abbc80828d4b87a7f126eb8d660a/dubbo-registry/dubbo-registry-api/src/main/java/org/apache/dubbo/registry/support/AbstractRegistry.java#L101-L102

In other words. 

- If the user does not manually configure the relevant information of the `MetadataReport`, then the information of the `Registry `will be used as the information of the `MetadataReport `by default (see method `useRegistryAsMetadataCenterIfNecessary&registryAsMetadataCenter`). 

- If the user does not configure the `file `in the `registry`, then the `registry `and `MetadataReport `use their default file names. ; 

- If the user adds the `file `parameter in the `registry `(such as` <dubbo:registryaddress="zookeeper://127.0.0.1:2181" file="/home/zs/registry.file"/>`), then the information of the registry will be in this `file`, and the information of the `MetadataReport` will be in the file generated by default.
——————————————————————————————————————————————

The current code does not seem to support specifying `file ` parameter for `MetadataReport`, I will try to add this feature.

其实就是说，一般我们都只配置`<dubbo:registry ....>`信息，如果你不指定`file`参数值，那么默认这个`MetadataReport`和`Registry`生产的缓存信息都在各自默认的文件中，名字是不一样的。如果你给registry指定了`file`参数值，那么registry的信息会在这个`file`下，而metadataReport的信息在自己的默认生成的文件中。

目前`MetadataReport`貌似不支持配置自己的`file`路径，即`<dubbo:metadata-report file="xxxx">`，我明天会尝试添加这个功能。

Well, but after simplifying the url, there is really no way to judge whether it should be registered. 
Do you have any good suggestions?
I think this should not affect it. If the order is not set, it means that the user actually doesn't care about the execution order of this filter.

> I think this should not affect it. If the order is not set, it means that the user actually doesn't care about the execution order of this filter.

Of course,  if user's  extension filter  does't set order,  we  can  think of it  as the user doesn't care about the order of user filter's execution.
However, the default order of dubbo's own  filter，for example, ExecuteLimitFilter and MonitorFilter ,the order between them, is disrupted. 
MonitorFilter should record  the number of concurres that actually execute the method, when the order is disrupted, it turned out to record the request concurres.  The number of concurrency in the monitoring data will be greater than the threshold. This will cause confusion to users, whether the concurrency settings of the service take effect.
see https://github.com/apache/dubbo/pull/7760
